node.title: Residents in Far North town of Kaimaumau evacuate as firefighters battle massive scrub blaze
node.description: About 20 firefighters and seven helicopters worked to contain the fire on Sunday.
node.content: ["Residents in the Far North town Kaimaumau were evacuating on Sunday night as firefighters battled a massive scrub fire that had grown to 600 hectares.\n", "A nearby school and marae were offering accommodation and Civil Defence was helping.", "Fire and Emergency New Zealand Northland district manager Wipari Henwood said the blaze spread faster than expected due to the weather conditions and posed a risk to the township.", "\"As the wind drops and temperate cools at night, it should slow the fire down.\"", "Henwood said crews will reinforce a containment line around the Kaimaumau township at first light, to protect the properties.", "\"Crews from Whangarei and Kaitaia specialising in structure protection will join the existing ground crews, along with nine helicopters.\"", "The blaze has been burning for more than 24 hours, and on Sunday about 20 firefighters, along with seven helicopters, worked to contain the fire. The fire is on Department of Conservation land.", "RNZ"]
